metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3248 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.Description: Untrusted search path vulnerability in Puppet Enterprise 2.8 before 2.8.7, Puppet before 2.7.26 and 3.x before 3.6.2, Facter 1.6.x and 2.x before 2.0.2, Hiera before 1.3.4, and Mcollective before 2.5.2, when running with Ruby 1.9.1 or earlier, allows local users to gain privileges via a Trojan horse file in the current working directory, as demonstrated using (1) rubygems/defaults/operating_system.rb, (2) Win32API.rb, (3) Win32API.so, (4) safe_yaml.rb, (5) safe_yaml/deep.rb, or (6) safe_yaml/deep.so; or (7) operatingsystem.rb, (8) operatingsystem.so, (9) osfamily.rb, or (10) osfamily.so in puppet/confine.

criterions.comment: facter package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.1-1ubuntu1').
mcollective package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.2+dfsg-1').
puppet package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.5-2').
